trans-unit.source: A component that accepts channels and associates them with a service.
A ChannelDispatcher object associates an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener> at a particular URI (called a listen URI) with an instance of a service.
Each <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> object can have many ChannelDispatcher objects, each associated with a different listener and listen URI for that service.

When a message arrives, the ChannelDispatcher queries each of the associated <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher> objects whether the endpoint can accept the message, and passes the message to the one that can.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher> object is responsible for processing messages from a ChannelDispatcher when the destination address of a message matches the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher.AddressFilter%2A> property and the message action matches the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher.ContractFilter%2A> property.
All properties that control the lifetime and behavior of a channel session are available for inspection or modification on the ChannelDispatcher object.

In addition to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher>, these include custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IChannelInitializer> objects, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener>, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost>, the associated and <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> class from the provided listener, with system-provided default timeouts.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener"></xref> for the channel dispatcher.
listener is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> class from the provided listener and binding, with system-provided default timeouts.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener"></xref> for the channel dispatcher.
The name of the binding used to configure the service.
listener is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> class from the provided listener and binding, with the specified default timeouts.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener"></xref> for the service.
The name of the binding used to configure the service.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.IDefaultCommunicationTimeouts> for the service.
listener is .
Gets a value that indicates whether the transacted accept method calls on listener are asynchronous.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the transacted accept method calls on listener are asynchronous; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Attaches the channel dispatcher to the host.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase"></xref> for the service.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets the name of the binding used to configure the service.
Used to obtain the binding name for the binding with which this channel dispatcher is associated.
The binding name of the service.
Gets a set of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IChannelInitializer"></xref> objects that you can use to inspect and add state to channels when they are first created.
Use this property to insert a custom channel initializer into the initialization collection to inspect or modify channel state when they are created.
This is also useful to perform the same behavior on outgoing channels if the contract associated with a dispatcher is a duplex contract.
A <xref:System.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IChannelInitializer"></xref> objects.
Stops the listener from accepting new channels.
Calling this method stops the listener listening.
Gets the default interval of time allowed for the channel dispatcher to close.

This default close timeout can be set using <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.ServiceModel.IDefaultCommunicationTimeouts%29>.
Otherwise, a service model default value of 1 minute is used.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies the default interval of time allowed for the channel dispatcher to close.
Gets the default interval of time allowed for the channel dispatcher to open.

This default open timeout can be set using <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.ServiceModel.IDefaultCommunicationTimeouts%29>.
Otherwise, a service model default value of 1 minute is used.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies the default interval of time allowed for the channel dispatcher to close.
Detaches the service host from the channel dispatcher.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> can only be detached when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
Sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> associated with the channel dispatcher to `null`.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase"></xref> for the service.
host is .
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets the endpoint dispatchers which forward messages to the channel endpoints.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> has a distinct <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher> for each endpoint that the channel can support.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher> to obtain access to runtime properties that enable you to customize the runtime across an entire endpoint.
A <xref:System.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection%601> of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher> which forward messages to the channel endpoints.
Gets a set of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler"></xref> objects that can be used to insert custom error handling functionality for an endpoint.
A <xref:System.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection%601> of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IErrorHandler"></xref> objects.
Gets the host for the service associated with the dispatcher.

Each <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> object can have many <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> objects, each associated with a different <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener> for that service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase"></xref> for the service associated with the dispatcher.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include the details about an exception in a fault.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the details about an exception are included in the faults; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets a value that indicates whether the accept method calls on the listener are done under a transaction.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the accept method calls on the listener are done under a transaction; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the receive method calls on the listener are done under a transaction.

The IsTransactedReceive property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the receive method calls on the listener are done under a transaction; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets the listener associated with the channel dispatcher.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> associates an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener> at a particular URI with an instance of a service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener"></xref> associated with the channel dispatcher.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the channel dispatcher adds addressing headers to request-reply messages.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.

Set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime.ManualAddressing%2A> property to `true` if you want to prevent the client from adding Message ID and ReplyTo addressing headers to request/response messages so that your application can control these headers.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the proxy does not add any addressing headers; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
See Remarks.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets or sets the maximum pending messages per channel.
An integer representing a maximum number of messages.
Gets or sets the maximum size for a transacted batch.

The MaxTransactedBatchSize property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
The maximum size for a transacted batch.
The value set is less than zero.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets or sets the SOAP message and WS-Addressing versions that are used or expected.
Specifies the versions of SOAP and WS-Addressing associated with a message and its exchange.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> that is used or expected.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Aborts the listener associated with the dispatcher.
Begins an asynchronous operation to close a channel listener for the dispatcher that must be completed within a specified interval of time.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies how long the close operation has to complete before timing out.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives the notification of the asynchronous completion of the close operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous operation to close a channel listener for the dispatcher.
Begins an asynchronous operation to open a channel listener for the dispatcher that must be completed within a specified interval of time.
The channel dispatcher must be associated with a non-`null` service host when this method is called.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies how long the open operation has to complete before timing out.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives the notification of the asynchronous completion of the open operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous open operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous operation to open a channel listener for the dispatcher.
The host or the message version is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Closes the channel listener associated with the dispatcher within a specified interval of time.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies the interval of time allowed for the listener to close.
Provides a trace of the closing of the endpoint dispatchers associated with the channel dispatcher.
Completes an asynchronous operation to close a channel listener for the dispatcher.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> returned by a call to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher.OnBeginClose*> method.
Completes an asynchronous operation to open a channel listener for the dispatcher.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> returned by a call to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher.OnBeginOpen*> method.
Opens the listener associated with the channel dispatcher.
The channel dispatcher must be associated with a non-`null` service host when this method is called and message version must be set to a non-`null` value.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies the interval of time allowed for the listener to open.
The host or the message version is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Populates and validates filter table used to dispatch to the endpoints.
The channel dispatcher must be associated with a non-`null` service host when this method is called.
The host is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Checks whether the channel dispatcher is attached to a host.
The channel dispatcher must be associated with a non-`null` service host on opening.
The host is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets whether ReceiveContext is enabled.
The ReceiveContext controls the manner in which messages are handled by the service, for example locking of the message as long as needed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if ReceiveContext is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the dispatcher uses synchronous calls to read messages from channels.

If a binding implements <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IBindingRuntimePreferences>, [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] assigns the value of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IBindingRuntimePreferences.ReceiveSynchronously%2A> property to this property.
So if this value is `true`, the `false` default value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IBindingRuntimePreferences.ReceiveSynchronously%2A> is overridden.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the dispatcher uses synchronous methods to read messages from channels; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets or sets whether messages are sent asynchronously.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if messages are sent asynchronously; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the service throttle for the service associated with the channel dispatcher.
This provides access to the controls used to optimize the availability and performance of a service.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ServiceThrottle"></xref> object.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets or sets the default isolation level for transactions.
Use the TransactionIsolationLevel property to get or set the default isolation level for new transactions created by the dispatcher for the service.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
One of the <xref href="System.Transactions.IsolationLevel"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Transactions.IsolationLevel"></xref>.
The isolation level set is not defined.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the default timeout for new transactions created by the dispatcher on behalf of the service.

This property can only be set when the instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcher> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state, as this is the only state that is both mutable and not disposed.
A <xref:System.TimeSpan> value that represents the default timeout period for transactions.
The default is <xref:System.TimeSpan>.
The value set is less than zero or is too large.
The communication object is in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
The communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> state.
